item.title: Fire at Sylhet REB control room cuts power to 5 upazilas
item.description: A massive fire broke out at the switching control room of the Rural Electrification Board in Fenchuganj, Sylhet, leaving five surrounding upazilas without power. The fire started around midnight on Thursday, October 16 at the control room located in the Palbari area of Fenchuganj upazila. Firefig

item.title: Madagascar coup leader Randrianirina sworn in as president
item.description: Madagascar’s coup leader Colonel Michael Randrianirina was sworn in as president on Friday to cheers, blaring trumpets and raised swords, days after taking control of the island nation in the wake of youth-led protests that forced out his predecessor. Ex-leader Andry Rajoelina, whom lawmaker

item.title: Trump says 100% tariffs on China not sustainable, still plans to meet Xi
item.description: US President Donald Trump said his proposed 100 percent tariff on goods from China would not be sustainable, but blamed Beijing for the latest impasse in trade talks that began with Chinese authorities tightening control over rare earth exports. Asked whether such a high tariff was sustainable and

item.title: Experts stress introduction of updated pneumococcal vaccine for children
item.description: FE ONLINE REPORT Experts from leading health institutions said on Friday emphasised introduction of an updated pneumococcal vaccine to ensure better protection and improved health outcomes for Bangladeshi children. They said that at a icddr,b roundtable discussion on introducing higher-valency pn

item.title: Over 5,000 motorcyclists rally demanding division status for Cumilla
item.description: Over 5,000 motorcyclists took to the Dhaka-Chattogram highway, demanding the creation of Cumilla Division, on Friday. The rally began in front of Hotel Nurjahan at Paduar Bazar, Bishwaroad, Cumilla, after Jumma prayers. Young riders from various areas gathered in large numbers, turning the highwa

item.title: US military holding rescued strike survivors on Navy ship, sources say
item.description: The U.S. military is holding two survivors aboard a Navy ship after rescuing them in the aftermath of a U.S. strike on Thursday on a suspected drug vessel in the Caribbean that killed two others, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday. item.title: NCP may still sign national consensus charter later: Religious Affairs Adviser
item.description: Religious Affairs Adviser Dr AFM Khalid Hossain on Friday said that the National Citizens’ Party (NCP) could still join the national consensus process even though it did not take part in the certificate signing ceremony.
